skills.name: Describe a point in the first quadrant of a 2D grid by giving its coordinates, where both values are integers
Describe a point in the second quadrant of a 2D grid by giving its coordinates, where both values are integers
Describe a point in the third quadrant of a 2D grid by giving its coordinates, where both values are integers
Mark a point in the third quadrant of a 2D grid having been given its coordinates, where both values are integers
Mark a point in the fourth quadrant of a 2D grid having been given its coordinates, where both values are integers

explanations.A: Not quite - it looks like you may have counted the zero in there. Remember to look at the axis to see which number the point is lined up with.
explanations.B: I think you may have got confused with the x and y coordinates. The axes should be labelled so you can look for which is which. If not, think x goes across and y to the sky!
explanations.C: The point is lined up with the 6 on the y axis so the y coordinate is 6.
explanations.D: I think you may have counted zero in and also mixed up your x and y coordinates. Look for the labels on the axes (or x is across, y to the sky) and remember to look at the number that the point is lined up with.

explanations.A: Not quite - it looks like you may have counted the zero in there. Remember to look at the axis to see which number the point is lined up with.
explanations.B: I think you may have got confused with the x and y coordinates. The axes should be labelled so you can look for which is which. If not, think x goes across and y to the sky!
explanations.C: I think you may have counted zero in and also mixed up your x and y coordinates. Look for the labels on the axes (or x is across, y to the sky) and remember to look at the number that the point is lined up with.
explanations.D: The point is lined up with the 5 on the y axis so the y coordinate is 5.

explanations.A: I think you have looked at point J but may have read off on the wrong axis. Remember we were asked for the x coordinate so which axis do you need to be reading off from?
explanations.B: I think you may have counted across and included zero. Remember to look at the number on the x axis that the point is lined up with.
explanations.C: x is the horizontal axis. The point J is lined up with -5 on the x axis so the x value is -5.
explanations.D: You're close! J is to the left of zero so it won't be a positive number.

explanations.A: I think you may have counted across and included zero. Remember to look at the number on the x axis that the point is lined up with.
explanations.B: x is the horizontal axis. The point K is lined up with -3 on the x axis so the x value is -3.
explanations.C: You're close! K is to the left of zero so it won't be a positive number.
explanations.D: I think you have looked at point K but may have read off on the wrong axis. Remember we were asked for the x coordinate so which axis do you need to be reading off from?

explanations.A: The point is lined up with -6 on the x axis and 5 on the y axis. Coordinates are always written as (x,y) so it's (-6,5).
explanations.B: Be careful, remember coordinates are always written as (x,y). Which number should be written first?
explanations.C: I think you may have got a bit mixed up with the signs. Be careful when reading off the values. Is the x value negative or positive? And what about the y value?
explanations.D: Be careful with the signs. The x value is to the left of zero so are these values positive or negative?

explanations.A: Be careful, remember coordinates are always written as (x,y). Which number should be written first?
explanations.B: Be careful with the signs. The x value is to the left of zero so are these values positive or negative?
explanations.C: The point is lined up with -2 on the x axis and 4 on the y axis. Coordinates are always written as (x,y) so it's (-2,4).
explanations.D: I think you may have got a bit mixed up with the signs. Be careful when reading off the values. Is the x value negative or positive? And what about the y value?

explanations.A: Almost! I think you may have missed a negative sign. Look carefully at the values.
explanations.B: Be careful, I think you may have got the x and y values mixed up. Remember coordinates are always written as (x,y) so which axis should you go to first?
explanations.C: I wonder if you have mistaken which number the negative belongs to. The sign is always in front of the number it belongs with. Which value is negative here?
explanations.D: Coordinates are always written as (x,y) so it's the point where it's lined up with 6 on the x axis and -3 on the y axis. It's D.

explanations.A: Be careful, I think you may have got the x and y values mixed up. Remember coordinates are always written as (x,y) so which axis should you go to first?
explanations.B: I wonder if you have mistaken which number the negative belongs to. The sign is always in front of the number it belongs with. Which value is negative here?
explanations.C: Coordinates are always written as (x,y) so it's the point where it's lined up with 4 on the x axis and -6 on the y axis. It's C.
explanations.D: Almost! I think you may have missed a negative sign. Look carefully at the values.

explanations.A: Coordinates are always written as (x,y) so it's the point where it's lined up with -4 on the x axis and -2 on the y axis. It's A.
explanations.B: I think you may have forgotten about the negative signs! Take a closer look at the numbers .
explanations.C: You're close! But I think you may have missed a negative sign. Take a closer look at the numbers.
explanations.D: Be careful, I think you may have got the x and y values mixed up. Remember coordinates are always written as (x,y) so which axis should you go to first?

explanations.B: You're close! But I think you may have missed a negative sign. Take a closer look at the numbers.
